page.title: 18GLYNDEBOURNE
page.content: Glyndebourne is first and foremost a family home. The present owners have four children. It is quite an old house built out of reddish brown bricks. The windows are quite big with small panes. From the house we went into the organ room, where people can sit and wait. We walked through the fire-place and were in the opera-house. The opera-house is 51 years old. There are 830 seats including the boxes. The cheapest seats are Â£18 and the dearest Â£38. The season lasts two and a half months and when the opera was first built it was only two weeks long. Many famous singers and conductors started their careers here. A house or flat nearby has to be found for those taking part in productions.
